intro: Conopharyngia angolensis, commonly known as the Angola pharyngium, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Angola. It belongs to the family Conopharyngiaceae and is characterized by its unique, elongated, and often spirally twisted stems. The plant exhibits a succulent habit, with thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapted to its arid and semi-arid environment. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically in dense inflorescences, and are usually green or pale yellow in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Conopharyngia angolensis is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat degradation and climate change.
